com.anotherservice.rest

Class Parameter

  • Object
    • Parameter

  • public class Parameter
extends Object
    This class is part of the REST service and defines the rules of compliance for potential Action parameters.
    The alias is used to retrieve the param name in the Request class. A Parameter can have several aliases in case the param name may be "one of" the defined names.
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele

    • Field Detail

      • allowInUrl

        public boolean allowInUrl
        Whether or not the next action can be used as value for this parameter.
        If Request.hasParam(String) is false, then the value is taken from Request.getAction().
        Default value : false

      • isMultipleValues

        public boolean isMultipleValues
        Whether or not this parameter allows multiple values.
        If true, the parameter value will be split using multipleValueDelimiterRegex
        Default value : false

      • multipleValueDelimiterRegex

        public String multipleValueDelimiterRegex
        The regex pattern used to split the parameter value.
        Used only if isMultipleValues is true
        Default value : (,|;|\s)

      • minMultipleValues

        public int minMultipleValues
        Minimum number of multiple values.
        Used only if isMultipleValues is true
        Default value : 1

      • maxMultipleValues

        public int maxMultipleValues
        Maximum number of multiple values.
        Used only if isMultipleValues is true
        Default value : 0

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional
        Whether or not the value is optional (can be missing).
        Note:
        an empty value is not considered to be ommited
        Default value : true

      • minLength

        public int minLength
        Minimum length of the value.
        Considered only if > 0
        Default value : 0

      • maxLength

        public int maxLength
        Maximum length of the value.
        Considered only if > 0
        Default value : 0

      • mustMatch

        public String mustMatch
        Custom regex pattern validation check.
        Considered only if not null. The check is performed using Pattern.matches().
        Default value : null

      • description

        public String description
        The description of this parameter. Used when requesting the help of the handler.

    • Method Detail

      • enforce

        public void enforce(boolean isOptional,
           int minLength,
           int maxLength,
           String mustMatch)
        Shorthand for most common restrictions : isOptional, minLength, maxLength and mustMatch
        Parameters:
        isOptional - Whether or not the value is optional
        minLength - Minimum length of the value
        maxLength - Maximum length of the value
        mustMatch - Custom regex pattern validation check

      • enforce

        public void enforce(boolean isOptional,
           int minLength,
           int maxLength)
        Shorthand for most common restrictions : isOptional, minLength, and maxLength
        Parameters:
        isOptional - Whether or not the value is optional
        minLength - Minimum length of the value
        maxLength - Maximum length of the value

      • enforce

        public void enforce(int minLength,
           int maxLength)
        Shorthand for most common restrictions : minLength and maxLength
        Parameters:
        minLength - Minimum length of the value
        maxLength - Maximum length of the value

      • enforce

        public void enforce(int minLength,
           int maxLength,
           String mustMatch)
        Shorthand for most common restrictions : minLength, maxLength and mustMatch
        Parameters:
        minLength - Minimum length of the value
        maxLength - Maximum length of the value
        mustMatch - Custom regex pattern validation check

      • getValue

        public String getValue()
                throws Exception
        Returns the value of the Request param matching one of the aliases.
        If the parameter allows multiple values, the first one is returned.
        Returns:
        the parameter value
        Throws:
        Exception - if the value does not comply to all rules
        See Also:
        Request.getCheckParam(Parameter)

      • getValues

        public Collection<String> getValues()
                             throws Exception
        Returns the value of the Request param matching one of the aliases.
        If the parameter does not allows multiple values, the value is wrapped in a Collection.
        Returns:
        the parameter values
        Throws:
        Exception - if any of the values does not comply to all rules
        See Also:
        Request.getCheckParam(Parameter)

      • hasAlias

        public boolean hasAlias(String name)
        Checks whether or not this parameter has the provided alias.
        Aliases are always lower case, thus a .toLowerCase() is automatically applied.
        Parameters:
        name - the alias to check
        Returns:
        true if the parameter has this alias, false otherwise

      • hasAlias

        public boolean hasAlias(Collection<String> names)
        Checks whether or not this parameter has any of the provided aliases.
        Aliases are always lower case, thus a .toLowerCase() is automatically applied.
        Parameters:
        names - the aliases to check
        Returns:
        true if the parameter has any of the aliases, false otherwise

      • hasAlias

        public boolean hasAlias(String[] names)
        Checks whether or not this parameter has any of the provided aliases.
        Aliases are always lower case, thus a .toLowerCase() is automatically applied.
        Parameters:
        names - the aliases to check
        Returns:
        true if the parameter has any of the aliases, false otherwise

      • getAlias

        public String getAlias()
        Returns the first alias of this parameter.
        Returns:
        the parameter alias

      • getAliases

        public Collection<String> getAliases()
        Returns the aliases of this parameter.
        Returns:
        the parameter aliases

      • addAlias

        public void addAlias(String alias)
        Adds the specified alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias to add
        Note:
        null or empty alias is silently ignored

      • addAlias

        public void addAlias(Collection<String> alias)
        Adds the specified aliases.
        Parameters:
        alias - the list of aliases to add
        Note:
        null or empty alias is silently ignored

      • addAlias

        public void addAlias(String[] alias)
        Adds the specified aliases.
        Parameters:
        alias - the list of aliases to add
        Note:
        null or empty alias is silently ignored

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this parameter.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The first alias, or "undefined" if no alias is defined
        See Also:
        getAlias()
